result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 74 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. Costs PAID IN FULL.
Maintain ful time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
No contact with victim or her residence until successful completion of domestic violence counseling and then only upon agent approval and victim approval. Defendant may communicate via third party relating to child.
Attend Thinking for Change or parental program.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sean M Sanders in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes correction to PSI.  State makes sentencing arguments.  Deanna H. gives testimony.  Defense makes sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

7 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 74 days) CONSECUTIVE
  - 4 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  - 3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  victim or her residence until successful completion of domestic violence counseling and then only upon agent approval and victim approval.  Defendant may communicate via third-party relating to child.  
*Attend Thinking For Change or parental program.
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00.  Apply cash bail; balance to be applied to 15CF1139.

DNA SURCHARGE:  none (prior to surcharge date)

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
